title: Set alias for columns in data set, but in expression builder, it still shows the old column names when selecting the dataset.
OB: When selecting the dataset in the expression builder, the old column names are displayed instead of the alias names.
EB:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the expression builder.
2. Select the dataset.
3. Double click on the first column name.

Expected Result: The first column in the expression builder should use the alias name instead of the original name according to scr 78193 in the tracker.
Actual Result: The original name of the first column is listed below in the expression builder, but the alias name appears above as row["column1"] after double clicking the original name.
SR:
1. Open the expression builder.
2. Select the dataset.
3. Double click on the first column name.

Expected Result: The first column in the expression builder should use the alias name instead of the original name according to scr 78193 in the tracker.

Actual Result: The original name of the first column is listed below in the expression builder, but the alias name appears above as row["column1"] after double clicking the original name.
